DOC.brief_summary: The aim propose project identify optimal implementation strategy use set evidence-based intervention aim increase early detection breast , prostate , colorectal cancer among African Americans model . These three intervention package interwoven single brand project , Project HEAL ( Health Early Awareness Learning ) deliver train Community Health Advisors ( CHA ) African-American church setting . The implementation sustainability evaluate use RE-AIM Framework . Fourteen African American church Prince George 's County , MD randomize traditional classroom training approach online training approach , CHA train approach level technical assistance vary ( in-person classroom training CHAs + monitoring/evaluation + technical assistance training vs. online training CHAs + monitoring evaluation , respectively ) . By vary train methodology level technical assistance , able determine level technical assistance lead successful implementation sustainability . We also identify church organizational capacity characteristic lead successful implementation sustainability . The specific aim research : ( 1 ) Package three intervention single brand project ( Project HEAL ) , develop local cancer screen resource guide , pilot test material train . ( 2 ) Implement Project HEAL 14 church Prince George 's County , Maryland . We evaluate implementation outcome involve treatment fidelity identify church organizational capacity characteristic lead successful implementation . We compare two implementation strategy ( traditional vs. online ) determine optimal level technical assistance necessary successful implementation . ( 3 ) Evaluate sustainability Project HEAL two-year period time . We identify church organizational capacity characteristic lead sustainability , compare two implementation strategy ( traditional vs. online ) determine optimal level technical assistance successful sustainability .
DOC.brief_title: Implementation Evidence-Based Cancer Early Detection Black Churches
